intro: Auriculardisia latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled auriculate, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
